intro: Argostemma anisophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
